CURRENT UPDATE TO QUARANTINE GUIDELINES FOR MCLOUD PUBLIC SCHOOLS

QUARANTINE GUIDELINES:
The CDC currently recommends a 14 day quarantine for anyone exposed to the COVID-19 virus. A verified positive case will require a 10 day quarantine, fever free for 24 hours, and improved symptoms. McLoud Public Schools will observe these recommendations.

Should an individual test positive for the virus, the area(s) where the infected individual spent time will be sanitized per CDC guidelines. The classroom/area will be closed for proper sanitation prior to reopening. Contact tracing will be followed and will include notifying individuals who were within 6 feet of the infected individual for 15 minutes or longer. School Reach calls will go out to students who were in the same area but not within 6 feet.

Depending on the magnitude of an exposure, the district will determine what course of action will be taken. These actions will be communicated to families in a timely manner. Please check our web page and social media for up to date information.

August 21, 2020

McLoud Families,

As you may have seen in local news reports, coronavirus cases in Pottawatomie County have increased significantly in the past week. A correctional facility within the county has reported over 100 positive cases with more test results pending. The test results from the correctional facility have led to the significant increase in the county numbers that you see reported daily on news stations and other media. In light of the information above, McLoud Public Schools, in collaboration with local health officials, does not feel that any changes to our school schedule or school protocols are necessary at this time. We will continue to monitor the situation, we will continue to collaborate with state and local officials, and we will continue to prioritize the health and safety of our students, staff, and families.

Respectfully, Steve Stanley, Superintendent

June 16, 2020

Dear McLoud Family,

It is hard to believe that another school year has come to an end. A strange end indeed, but an end all the same. We experienced many new adventures this spring. I am certain we will be strengthened by this journey and that it will help us to appreciate the little things.

I would like to take this opportunity to thank the students, staff, and community for their support for the last three years. It truly has been a pleasure to serve as the high school principal. I built lasting relationships with many wonderful people. Furthermore, I got to learn and grow along with each of you. For these and a million other reasons, I am truly grateful.

I have accepted a new position within the district and am currently making that transition. I will be the Executive Director of Administrators/Curriculum and Instruction. I am excited at the new challenge and hope to continue to serve the McLoud district to the very best of my abilities.

In closing, I wish you all a very happy, safe, and enjoyable summer. Go Redskins!

Sincerely,

Rhonda Hockenbury

Alright Redskins, here is the plan. I formed a committee and we met this afternoon to discuss graduation. We will proceed with the scheduled graduation parade on May 22nd. Seniors will receive their diplomas on this date.

I hope this eases your anxiety and gives you an event to look forward to this summer to recognize our seniors' rite of passage.

Go Redskins!

Sincerely,
Mrs. Hockenbury

McLoud Family,
In an effort to reduce interactions between school staff and the community for health and safety as well as follow guidance for CDC social distancing, McLoud Public Schools has adjusted their meal plan to meet new state guidelines.

Tomorrow, Tuesday, March 24, multiple meals will be given at pickup in order for students to have two meals each day for the remainder of this week. Meals should be picked up tomorrow from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm. Next Monday, March 30th multiple meals will be given on-site so that students will have two meals each day for a four-day period. Monday will be the only day meals can be picked up. We will remain on the south side of the ECC from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.

The district is pleased to provide this service for ANY children 18 and under (over 18 if currently enrolled). Children do not have to be enrolled at McLoud Schools to receive these meals. We truly hope that all of you will take advantage of this service. Stay strong and stay safe.
